etymology.description: 癶(癶) (bō, "footsteps") + 豆(豆) (dòu, "earthenware footed vessel") = climbing steps like ascending a ladder -> ascend
etymology.interpretation: The character 登(dēng) combines "steps" with an "earthenware vessel," hinting at the action of climbing or ascending, similar to stepping onto an elevated object.

examples.chinese: 他登上高峰(他登上高峰)，俯瞰群山(俯瞰群山)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dēng shàng gāofēng, fǔkàn qúnshān.
examples.english: He ascended to the peak and admired the surrounding mountains.

examples.chinese: 我们明天登长城(我們明天登長城)，感受历史气息(感受歷史氣息)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen míngtiān dēng Chángchéng, gǎnshòu lìshǐ qìxī.
examples.english: We will ascend the Great Wall tomorrow to experience its historical ambience.

examples.chinese: 登山是一种锻炼(登山是一種鍛煉)。
examples.english: Mountain climbing is a form of exercise.
